title: Investigation: How Climate Data Is Being Manipulated by Industry
introText: A six-month investigation reveals how fossil fuel companies have funded research designed to cast doubt on climate science. Internal documents show coordinated campaigns to delay action on global warming.

content.content: Internal industry documents obtained by our investigation show that major oil companies funded think tanks and researchers specifically to create the appearance of scientific uncertainty about climate change.

The playbook was borrowed from tobacco: fund contrarian research, amplify minority scientific views, and lobby against regulation. The goal was not to win the scientific debate but to delay policy action.
State attorneys general are now investigating whether these campaigns constitute fraud. Climate litigation against fossil fuel companies is accelerating based on evidence of deliberate deception.

summary: An investigation reveals how fossil fuel companies manipulated climate data and funded research to delay action on global warming, with legal consequences underway.
